definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to exhaust
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously

sentences.english: The workers laid about them to increase production.
sentences.chinese: 工人们竭尽全力增加生产。

sentences.english: Although the stone inflammation does utmost, still had lost to Chen Fei.
sentences.chinese: 虽然石炎竭尽全力，仍是输给了陈飞。

sentences.english: Craig was an old friend, and I had done my best to bring them together.
sentences.chinese: 克雷格是我的老朋友，我竭尽全力让他们一起合作。

sentences.english: McConnell said Republicans would fight the health-care legislation as hard as they could.
sentences.chinese: 麦康奈尔说，共和党人将竭尽全力反对健保法案。

sentences.english: The prime minister would go to any lengths to keep his government in power.
sentences.chinese: 首相会竭尽全力务使他的政府能继续执政。

sentences.english: “We are striving to learn from the Japanese event,” says Becker.
sentences.chinese: “我们在竭尽全力从日本事件中汲取教训，”贝克说。

sentences.english: I tried my best to get some points for Toyota.
sentences.chinese: 我竭尽全力想为丰田车队挣得一些分数。

sentences.english: Suk is a good player and he always does his utmost.
sentences.chinese: 石是一名很棒的球员，并且他总是竭尽全力。

sentences.english: We are doing everything in our power to offer support and help.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在竭尽全力地提供支援和帮助。

sentences.english: So we do what we can to understand them, to be ready for change.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们竭尽全力去弄懂它们，为改变做好准备。

sentences.english: China has help the tsunami-hit regions of Asia.
sentences.chinese: 中国承诺竭尽全力帮助受海啸袭击的亚洲地区。

sentences.english: A hero tries to do and give his very best.
sentences.chinese: 英雄总是想方计法并竭尽全力地做事。

sentences.english: She was also curious, and would have given much to find out the cause of Bertha's outburst .
sentences.chinese: 她还好奇，她将竭尽全力探出伯莎悲哀发作的原因。

sentences.english: They’d exhaust themselves trying to juggle family and work.
sentences.chinese: 他们要竭尽全力的去应付家庭和工作。

sentences.english: 'We tried really hard to push the spiral lamp,' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说他们真的是竭尽全力地去推广螺旋灯泡。

sentences.english: Try it: go outside and sprint all-out for two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 试试吧，走到外面，竭尽全力地冲刺两分钟。

definition: to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
to do at all costs/to make an all-out effort
with all one's strength/full strength/all-out (effort)/fully (support)
to use up/to exhaust
to do one's utmost
to try one's utmost/to strive
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
heart and soul/wholeheartedly
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
to do all one can/to give all one has
to think up every possible method (idiom); to devise ways and means/to try this, that and the other
reckless/regardless of everything
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
to make a supreme effort/at all costs
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
